posts.post_content:
Many consider her the best card in Legions and rightly so. There is nothing like your opponent's face after he plays  [wrath of god](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= wrath of god) or something only to end up staring down a whole mess of bears.  
  
She also makes an insane combo with [nantuko husk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=nantuko husk) and other sac creatures, especially when she goes back to your hand with [wirewood symbiote](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wirewood symbiote).  
  
\*Whoops, i meant to say the best *green* card in legions, my mistake.
posts.html:
Many consider her the best card in Legions and rightly so. There is nothing like your opponent's face after he plays wrath of god or something only to end up staring down a whole mess of bears.

She also makes an insane combo with nantuko husk and other sac creatures, especially when she goes back to your hand with wirewood symbiote.

*Whoops, i meant to say the best green card in legions, my mistake.

posts.post_content:
I seriously can't quite remember her being called the best card in Legions by many, given that this set also includes [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=42049) for instance.   
  
Although i agree that this is a pretty neat card.  
Having flash, this is an awesome response to board hosers.  
And in general it's also a cheap choice to get two or more 2/2 bodies for just ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) after combat.  
Yet i'd preferably play her with an ensured use given by having something to get rid of your creatures.  
Permanents that can sacrifice creatures like the aforementioned Nantuko Husk are useful.  
Even better if they return another creature like [Apprentice Necromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apprentice Necromancer), [Doomed Necromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomed Necromancer) or [Hell's Caretaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hell's Caretaker).  
If you return another dead Caller of the Claw and produce further tokens.  
Therefore [Second Sunrise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Second Sunrise) might also be a good choice.  
  
Bouncing it with [Wirewood Symbiote](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wirewood Symbiote) might also indeed b... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I seriously can't quite remember her being called the best card in Legions by many, given that this set also includes Akroma, Angel of Wrath for instance.

Although i agree that this is a pretty neat card.
Having flash, this is an awesome response to board hosers.
And in general it's also a cheap choice to get two or more 2/2 bodies for just after combat.
Yet i'd preferably play her with an ensured use given by having something to get rid of your creatures.
Permanents that can sacrifice creatures like the aforementioned Nantuko Husk are useful.
Even better if they return another creature like Apprentice Necromancer, Doomed Necromancer or Hell's Caretaker.
If you return another dead Caller of the Claw and produce further tokens.
Therefore Second Sunrise might also be a good choice.

posts.post_content: Yeah pretty neat card. Another good use for her is on the sideboard for a mono-green elf deck. This is an elf deck's best (and almost only) defense against board hosers (pyroclasm, wog, damnation, etc), which otherwise can set you back several turns or make you lose the game.
posts.html:
Yeah pretty neat card. Another good use for her is on the sideboard for a mono-green elf deck. This is an elf deck's best (and almost only) defense against board hosers (pyroclasm, wog, damnation, etc), which otherwise can set you back several turns or make you lose the game.

Posted By: SpeedOfDark (2/19/2010 1:11:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Quite possibly my favorite card. The artwork and flavor rock; if you're a green mage, you gotta love an elf lady dressed as a bear leading a gang of eerie bears, all of whom are \*\*\*ed off about creature destruction. and turning your opponents mass removal into an ursine [plague wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=plague wind) is awesome. Who cares if your tech creatures just turned into regular 2/2 bears when they're the only things on the board and are ready to smash face. Green needs things to hose mass removal and this may be the best card for it.
  
   
Even using it as simply an [ashcoat bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ashcoat bear) for 3 can be useful at times. I once threw it out onto the battlefield to team up with my llanowar elves and block ob nixilis who had not gotten bigger yet. If I hadn't done that, I probably would have lost.
  
   
You can even combo caller with your own creature kabooms and sacrifices if you don't think she's relevant enough.

Who cares if your tech creatures just turned into regular 2/2 bears when they're the only things on the board and are ready to smash face. Green needs things to hose mass removal and this may be the best card for it.

Even using it as simply an ashcoat bear for 3 can be useful at times. I once threw it out onto the battlefield to team up with my llanowar elves and block ob nixilis who had not gotten bigger yet. If I hadn't done that, I probably would have lost.

You can even combo caller with your own creature kabooms and sacrifices if you don't think she's relevant enough.

posts.post_content:
Bear revenge with attached 2/2, 3 mana and instant speed!  
Use when people attempt to clear your board, or when you sac it for stuff like [Goblin Bombardment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bombardment) and such  
  
4.5/5
